page.title: 20Farming
page.content: The 3 main crops grown are wheat, barley and grass,cattle or sheep are reared.Crop rotation is either 4 or 9 years of cereal followed by grass or kale.The machinery on the farm is very important and includes tractors, combine harvesters,crop sprayers and ploughs. At the time of sowing crops are fertilised with a compound fertiliser consisting of nitrogen,phosphate and potash.Straight nitrogen is also applied but only in spring.There is slight soil erosion and some trouble associated with being on the edge of a town,such as gypsies and dumping of rubbish.The type of farming is usually decided by economic factors. Crops are exported from Shoreham and Southhampton harbours and sold for animal feed,flour milling or food.The by-pass has little effect on this.
